title: Chemistry/TEP Joint Graduate Degree Program | Graduate Division
raw_text:
Home
Graduate Programs
Departments
Chemistry/TEP Joint Graduate Degree Program
Chemistry/TEP Joint Graduate Degree Program
The Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry and the Teacher Education Program (TEP) offer a joint program which allows you to get your Masters of Arts with a Chemical Education Emphasis during year one of the program with the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry and your Single Subject (SST, Secondary) California State Teaching Credentials in year two of the program. Applicants successful in gaining admission to the MA/SST program may choose to add the optional MEd objective upon arrival at UCSB.
The two-year full time program is designed to build your chemistry content knowledge along with giving you the academic and practical skills needed to begin a teaching career. During year one of the program you will take graduate chemistry content classes, serve as a teaching assistant for the general chemistry labs, perform research and participate in a department affiliated outreach program. During year two of the program you will student teach as well as take course work so that the knowledge, theories, and concepts taught at the University can be directly and immediately applied in the classroom setting.
Mailing Address
Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry
University of California, Santa Barbara
and Gevirtz Graduate School of Education, TEP
Santa Barbara, CA 93106-9510
(USA)
Website
https://www.chem.ucsb.edu/graduate/joint-matep-program
Email
gradprog@chem.ucsb.edu
Department Phone Number
(805) 893-2931
Degrees Offered
MA/SST Credentials, MA/SST Credentials/MEd
Deadlines
Fall Only:
January 15, 2026 (by 11:59 PM PST)
Requirements
Online application
:
https://www.graddiv.ucsb.edu/eapp
Statement of Purpose, Personal History Statement, and Resume or CV.
Please note the TEP Statement of Purpose prompts differ from the eApp essay prompts.
Please respond to the Statement of Purpose prompts found in the
Application Handbook
.
Three letters of recommendation (submitted online by letter writers)
Transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended where 12 or more quarter units (8 or more semester units) were earned (submitted online)
Program & State Requirements: See the
Application Handbook
for the deadlines of all Program and state credentialing requirements. Please be aware that UCSB TEP requires:
30 hours of pre-professional experience, completed by 1/15/26; and
The Subject Matter Competency requirement to be in progress by 1/15/26.
All applicants will be invited to interview; the interview is an integral part of your complete application.
Final/Official transcripts will be required for all applicants who are admitted and have indicated their intent to enroll at UC Santa Barbara by submitting a Statement of Intent to Register (SIR). UC Santa Barbara reserves the right to require official transcripts at any time during the admissions process, and rescind any offer of admission made if discrepancies between uploaded and official transcript(s) are found.
For applicants whose native language is not English: TOEFL Internet-Based Test (IBT) total score of 80, or IELTS Overall Band score of 7, or Duolingo English Test total score of 120, or higher. See the
Application Handbook
for more information.
Emphases
N/A
Specializations
N/A

application_requirements.english_tests: TOEFL Internet-Based Test (IBT) total score of 80, or IELTS Overall Band score of 7, or Duolingo English Test total score of 120, or higher.
application_requirements.work_experience: 30 hours of pre-professional experience, completed by 1/15/26
application_requirements.documents: Statement of Purpose, Personal History Statement, Resume or CV, three letters of recommendation, transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended
application_requirements.summary: Applicants must submit an online application, including a Statement of Purpose, Personal History Statement, Resume or CV, three letters of recommendation, and transcripts. English proficiency tests are required for non-native speakers. 30 hours of pre-professional experience and an interview are also required.

program_background.environment: The program combines graduate chemistry content classes with teaching assistantships, research, and outreach programs in the first year, followed by student teaching and coursework in the second year.

training_outcomes.goals: The program is designed to build chemistry content knowledge and provide academic and practical skills needed to begin a teaching career.
training_outcomes.career_paths: Teaching career with a Single Subject (SST, Secondary) California State Teaching Credential.
